meta_description.title: Pong - Wikipedia
meta_description.text: Pong is a two-dimensional sports game that simulates table tennis. The player controls an in-game paddle by moving it vertically across the left or right side ...Genre(s): SportsMode(s): Single-player, multiplayerPublisher(s): NA/‎EU‎: ‎Atari‎; ‎JP‎: Atari Japan ...‎Release: NA: 29 November 1972; ‎JP‎: Novemb...‎

meta_description.title: The Inside Story of Pong and the Early Days of Atari - WIRED
meta_description.text: Nov 15, 2017 — Installed in a bar in Sunnyvale, California, the first 'Pong' prototype was so popular that the flood of quarters jammed the machine.

meta_description.title: Virtual Pong @ SharperImage.com
meta_description.text: Virtual Pong is the fast-paced, futuristic game that keeps players on their toes with a simulated “ball of light” that bounces off the walls and ceiling.

knowledge_panel.description: pong is a table tennis–themed arcade sports video game, featuring simple two-dimensional graphics, manufactured by atari and originally released in 1972. wikipedia
